Package com.rikuthin.entities.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.entities.Entity
com.rikuthin.entities.MobileEntity
com.rikuthin.entities.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updateable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlueMage, MagentaMage, RedMage
public class Enemy extends MobileEntity
Represents an enemy in the game that is mobile and can move within the game world.

This class extends MobileEntity and includes functionality for attacking using a BulletSpawner.

  • Field Details

    • bulletSpawner

      protected BulletSpawner bulletSpawner
      The enemy's BulletSpawner, responsible for shooting Bullets.

    • attackTimerMs

      protected long attackTimerMs
      The duration (in milliseconds) an enemy can continuously attack before needing to cool down.

    • elapsedAttackTimeMs

      protected long elapsedAttackTimeMs
      The elapsed time (in milliseconds) of the current attack wave.

    • attackCooldownMs

      protected long attackCooldownMs
      The cooldown duration (in milliseconds) before the enemy can attack again after an attack wave ends.

      This is separate from the BulletSpawner's spawn delay, as it controls the waiting time between attack waves rather than the firing rate within a wave.

    • elapsedAttackCooldownMs

      protected long elapsedAttackCooldownMs
      The elapsed time (in milliseconds) since the enemy started cooling down.

    • lastUpdateTime

      protected long lastUpdateTime
      The timestamp (in milliseconds) of the last update call.

      public BulletSpawner getBulletSpawner()

      Returns:
      the bullet spawner.

    • isAttacking

      public boolean isAttacking()
      Returns whether the enemy is attacking/firing bullets.
      Returns:
      true if attacking, false otherwise.

    • getAttackCooldownMs

      public long getAttackCooldownMs()

      Returns:
      The attack cooldown time in milliseconds.

      Sets the enemy's BulletSpawner
      Parameters:

    • setIsAttacking

      public void setIsAttacking(boolean isAttacking) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets whether the enemy is attacking/firing bullets.
      Parameters:
      isAttacking - true if the enemy should start firing bullets, false to stop firing.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if isAttacking is true but the enemy has no bullet spawner.

    • setAttackCooldownMs

      public void setAttackCooldownMs(long attackDelayMs)
      Sets the entity's attack delay in milliseconds. Minimum value is 1 ms.
      Parameters:
      attackDelayMs - The attack delay.

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget(Point target)
      Updates the x and y velocities of new bullets to aim towards the given target coordinates.
      Parameters:
      target - The (x, y) coordinates on-screen the Enemy should aim towards.

    • canAttack

      public boolean canAttack()
      Checks whether the enemy can perform an attack.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy has a bullet spawner, is not on cooldown, and has remaining attack time in the current wave.

    • isOnAttackCooldown

      public boolean isOnAttackCooldown()
      Checks if the attack cooldown is active.
      Returns:
      true if the attack cooldown has not expired, false otherwise.

    • attack

      public void attack()
      Performs an attack if the enemy is allowed to do so. Automatically stops attacking when the attack timer runs out.

    • move

      public void move()
      Updates the enntity's current position using their current movement speed values.

      Extends MobileEntity.move() by ensuring the enemy still within screen boundaries.

      Overrides:
      move in class MobileEntity

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state of the entity, including movement and attack state.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updateable
      Overrides:
      update in class MobileEntity

    • correctPosition

      protected void correctPosition()
      Ensures the entity remains within screen boundaries.

      Extends Entity.correctPosition() by adding horizontal bounce behavior when the enemy reaches the screen's edges.

      Overrides:
      correctPosition in class Entity
